syllabus: CLAT 2025 syllabus includes English Language, Current Affairs including General Knowledge, Legal Reasoning, Logical Reasoning, and Quantitative Techniques.
english_questions: The English section usually contains around 28 to 32 multiple-choice questions.
cutoff_nlsiu: In 2024, the cut-off for NLSIU Bangalore was approximately 114.75 for General category candidates.
total_questions: CLAT consists of 150 questions in total across all sections.
duration: The exam duration for CLAT is 2 hours (120 minutes).
marking_scheme: Each correct answer awards 1 mark, and 0.25 marks are deducted for each wrong answer.
application_fee: The CLAT 2025 application fee is INR 4000 for General/OBC and INR 3500 for SC/ST candidates.
exam_date: CLAT 2025 is scheduled to be held in December 2024 (tentatively on the first Sunday).
eligibility: Candidates must have passed Class 12 with at least 45% marks (40% for SC/ST).
participating_universities: There are 24 National Law Universities (NLUs) participating in CLAT 2025.
preparation_books: Recommended books include Universal's Guide to CLAT, Word Power Made Easy, and Legal Aptitude for CLAT and other Law Exams.
